result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon M. Kotula

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon M. Kotula not in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Devon M. Kotula.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon M. Kotula not in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Devon M. Kotula. Victim also present in court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel on behalf of defendant. Speedy trial rights reserved. Adjournment requested 30-45 days out. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 230486,
Payable Number: 267003,
Receipt Number: 22R 014652,
Amount: $20.00
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon M. Kotula in court. Defendant will retain an attorney. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Warrant quashed. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
